 Depends on what kind of day it has been. Generally I pour over ice. I have been known, on particularly horrific days, to forgoe the ice and the lime, and just pour my stoli in a water tumbler.
 
 I have not drank rum for a long time. When I was younger there was a girl I ran with who was my drinking buddy. She was just a little thing, but drank like a sailor. Originally we drank Bacardi Limon, until one night she got really sick on it. Then we drank a nasty rum called "parrot bay" (by captain morgan IIRC). The upside to parrot bay was that it was only $23 for a gallon of it, and we would drink a gallon a night. Now I can't even stand the smell of it without the contents of my stomach making a hasty exit thought my mouth. 
 
 Anymore, I just stick to my vodka, or the home made rye provided by a local farmer. I can't even stand the cheap vodka anymore (I remember back in the old days when we went through Bartons like it was water). Anymore I stick mostly with Stolichnya or Grey Goose, not really expensive, but not rotgut either, which bartons certainly was.
If you're a gin head at all, try Boodles. It's a whole lot better than Pepsi or Coke!
Ever tried Bourbon and Pepsi, or how about A Rum and Pepsi? I thought not.

Pour a large Coke in a tall glass, no ice.
 Add two metal skewers and a silver teaspoon.
 balance a wooden skewer or pencil across the lip of the glass and hang the two metal skewers from it.The skewers must not touch the sides of the glass,each other or the teaspoon.
 Connect up a 9 volt lantern battery to both of the skewers.If you wish to add a small radio to the circuit, not only will it provide entertainment, it will provide audible confirmation that the electricity is flowing.
 
 Of course, those of a scientific bent will realise that none of the above will achieve any noticeable results. However, it will keep the Coke drinkers amused while I enjoy my Diet Pepsi and donut. emoticon_xclown
